questions.questionText: Which describes a 'change authority'?

answers.text: A model used to determine who will assess a change
A person who approves a change
A tool used to help changes
A way to manage the people aspects of change

questions.questionText: What do customer perceptions and business outcomes help to define?

answers.text: The total cost of a service

questions.questionText: Which MOST helps an organization adapt ITIL concepts so that they apply to the organization's specific circumstances?
Which term relates to service levels aligned with the needs of service consumers?
Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement practice?

answers.text: Handing compliments and complaints from user to identify improvements.
Improving relationships with and between stakeholders.
Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives.
Identifying the cause unplanned interruptions to service.

questions.questionText:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence.
A user is [?] that uses services.
A. an organization
B. a role
C. a team
D. a supplier
Which is part of the 'focus on value' guiding principle?

answers.text: Understanding what services help the service consumer
Reducing the number of steps in the customer experience
Assessing services to identify parts that can be reused
Identifying activities that can be achieved in smaller iterations

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle recommends eliminating activities that do not contribute to the creation of value?
Which statement about value-creating activities is CORRECT?

answers.text: Each value stream should be designed with a specific combination of service value chain activities.
Service value chain activities have pre-determined dependencies on ITIL practices.
A value stream is an operating model for creating value through products and services.
Organizations should ensure that each value stream is applicable to many scenarios.

questions.questionText: Which is a service request?

answers.text: Requesting a workaround for an issue
Requesting information about how to create a document
Requesting an enhancement to an application
Requesting investigation of a degraded service

questions.questionText: What should be done for every problem?

answers.text: It should have a workaround to reduce the impact
It should be prioritized based on its potential impact and probability
It should be resolved so that it can be closed
It should be diagnosed to identify possible solutions

questions.questionText: What is defined as a change of state that has significance for the management of an IT service?
Which phase of problem management includes analysing incidents to look for patterns and trends?
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. A known error is a problem that has been [?] and has not been resolved.
Which dimension of service management considers the workflows and controls needed to deliver services?
What is the starting point for optimization?

answers.text: Determining where the most positive impact would be
Understanding the vision and objectives of the organization

questions.questionText: Why should incidents be prioritized?

answers.text: To help automated matching of incidents to problems or known errors
To identify which support team the incident should be escalated to
To ensure that incidents with the highest business impact are resolved first
To encourage a high level of collaboration within and between teams

questions.questionText: Which is an activity of 'problem identification'?
Which practice provides support for managing feedback, compliments and complaints from users?
Which is the BEST example of an emergency change?

answers.text: The implementation of a planned new release of a software application
A low-risk computer upgrade implemented as a service request
The implementation of a security patch to a critical software application
A scheduled major hardware and software implementation

questions.questionText: What is important for a 'continual improvement register' (CIR)?

answers.text: Improvement ideas are documented, assessed and prioritized
Improvement ideas from many sources are kept in a single CIR
Improvement ideas that are not being actioned immediately are removed from the CIR
Improvement ideas are tested, funded and agreed

questions.questionText: Which statement about the steps to fulfill a service request is CORRECT?

answers.text: They should be complex and detailed
They should be well-known and proven
They should be brief and simple

questions.questionText: What defines the requirements for a service and takes responsibility for the outcomes of service consumption?
Which is part of service provision?

answers.text: The management of resources configured to deliver the service
The management of resources needed to consume the service
The grouping of one or more services based on one or more products
The joint activities performed to ensure continual value co-creation

questions.questionText: What should be used to set user expectations for request fulfilment times?

answers.text: The consumer demand for the service
The time that the customer indicates for service delivery
The service levels of the supplier
The time needed to realistically deliver the service

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle recommends organizing work into smaller, manageable sections that can be executed and completed in a timely manner?

Which TWO are important aspects of the 'service request management' practice? (1)Standardization and automation (2)Providing a variety of channels for access (3).Establishing a shared view of targets(4).Policies for approvals
What is the reason for using a balanced bundle of service metrics?

answers.text: It reduces the number of metrics that need to be collected
It reports each service element separately
It provides an outcome-based view of services
It facilitates the automatic collection of metrics

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle emphasizes the need to understand the flow of work in progress, identify bottlenecks, and uncover waste?
What is the expected outcome from using a service value chain?
When should a change request be submitted to resolve a problem?

answers.text: As soon as a solution for the problem has been identified
As soon as a workaround for the problem has been identified
As soon as the analysis of the frequency and impact of incidents justifies the change
As soon as the analysis of cost, risks and benefits justifies the change

questions.questionText: Which statement about the 'continual improvement' practice is CORRECT?

answers.text: Continual improvement participation should be limited to a small dedicated team.
It is the role of senior management to authorize improvement initiatives.
Training should be provided to those involved in continual improvement.
A single continual improvement register should be maintained by senior management.

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle focuses on reducing costs and human errors?
Which statement about the 'continual improvement model' is CORRECT?

answers.text: Organizations should work through the steps of the model in the sequence in which they are presented
The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals
The model is applicable to only certain parts of the service value system
Organizations should use an additional model or method to link improvements to customer value

questions.questionText: What is a recommendation of the 'focus on value' guiding principle?

answers.text: Make 'focus on value' a responsibility of the management
Focus on the value of new and significant projects first
Focus on value for the service provider first
Focus on value at every step of the improvement

questions.questionText: Which is handled as a service request?

answers.text: An investigation to identify the cause of an incident
A compliment about an IT support team
The failure of an IT service
An emergency change to implement a security patch

questions.questionText: What are the ITIL guiding principles used for?

answers.text: To help an organization make good decisions
To direct and control an organization
To identify activities that an organization must perform in order to deliver a valuable service
To ensure that an organization's performance continually meets stakeholders' expectations

questions.questionText: What should a release policy include?

answers.text: The process owner and process manager for each type of release
The roles and responsibilities for incident and problem resolution
The naming convention and expected frequency of each type of release
The naming convention for all configuration items (CI) recorded in the configuration management system (CMS)

questions.questionText: Which two are considered part of the 'organizations and people' dimension of service management? (1). Systems of authority (2). Culture(3). Relationships between organizations(4). Workflows

Arrange the following steps of software lifecycle in correct order.
1. Retire 2. Test 3. Operate 4. Deploy 5. Ideation 6. Develop 7. Design

answers.text: Ideation, Design, Develop, Deploy, Test, Operate, Retire
Retire, Test, Operate, Deploy, Ideation, Develop, Design
Ideation, Test, Develop, Deploy, Design, Operate, Retire

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The use of [?] should support, not replace what is observed when using the 'start where you are' guiding principle.
Which statement about 'continual improvement' is CORRECT?

answers.text: All improvement ideas should be logged in a single 'continual improvement register'
A single team should carry out 'continual improvement' across the organization
'Continual improvement' should have minimal interaction with other practices
Everyone in the organization is responsible for some aspects of 'continual improvement'

questions.questionText: Which statement about the 'service desk' practice is CORRECT?

answers.text: It provides a link with stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels
It carries out change assessment and authorization
It investigates the cause of incidents
It needs a practical understanding of the business processes

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating outcomes that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific [?] and risks.
Which dimension includes a workflow management system?
Which is an example of improving service utility using service management automation?

answers.text: Pre-determined routing of a service request
Reducing the time to compile service data

questions.questionText: Which describes a 'change authority'?

answers.text: A model used to determine who will assess a change
A person who approves a change
A tool used to help changes
A way to manage the people aspects of change

questions.questionText: Which practice includes conducting regular reviews to ensure that services are still appropriate and relevant?
Which stakeholders co-create value in a service relationship?
When planning 'continual improvement', which approach for assessing the current state of a service is CORRECT?

answers.text: An organization should always use a single technique to ensure metrics are consistent
An organization should always use a strength, weakness, opportunity and threat (SWOT) analysis
An organization should always develop competencies in methodologies and techniques that will meet their needs
An organization should always use an approach that combines Lean, Agile and DevOps methodologies

questions.questionText: Which statement about the known error database (KEDB) is CORRECT?

answers.text: It is maintained by the service desk and updated with the details of each new incident
It is a part of the configuration management database (CMDB) and contains workarounds
It is maintained by problem management and is used by the service desk to help resolve incidents
It is maintained by incident management and contains solutions to be implemented by problem management

questions.questionText: Which ITIL guiding principle recommends using existing services, processes and tools when improving services?
What can a service remove from the consumer and impose on the consumer?
Which is the correct combination of items that makes up an IT service?
Which guiding principle describes the importance of doing something, instead of spending a long time analysing different options?
Which statement about the use of measurement in the 'start where you are' guiding principle is CORRECT?

answers.text: It should always be used to support direct observation
It should always be used instead of direct observation
Measured data is always more accurate than direct observation
The act of measuring always positively impacts results

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The purpose of the 'supplier management' practice is to ensure that the organization's suppliers and their performances are [?] appropriately to support the seamless provision of quality products and services.
Which of the following is an example of workaround?

answers.text: A. A defective network switch is replaced with a new one
B. An email server is restored after an incident is reported
C. Server memory is increased when the server is unresponsive
D. A server is restarted to resolve an incident

questions.questionText: What term is used to describe whether a service will meet availability, capacity and security requirements?
Which ITIL practice recommends performing service reviews to ensure that services continue to meet the needs of the organization?
Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
A service offering may include access to resources and service actions, which is an example of a service action?

answers.text: A. A mobile phone enables a user to work remotely
B. A password allows a user to connect to a WiFi network
C. A license allows a user to install a software product
D. A service desk agent provides support to user

questions.questionText: Which describes a standard change?

answers.text: A. A high-risk change that needs very thorough assessment
B. A change that is typically implemented as a service request
C. A change that must be implemented as soon as possible
D. A change that needs to be scheduled, assessed and authorized following a defined process

questions.questionText: What are the types of asset management?

answers.text: A. IT asset management and software asset management
C. IT asset management and technical management
D. Operational management and IT asset management

questions.questionText: What is a definition of a problem?

answers.text: A. An unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service
B. A cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents
C. An incident for which a full resolution is not yet available
D. Any change of state that has significance for the management of a configuration item (CI)

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of problem management?

answers.text: A. Reduces the likelihood and impact of incidents
B. Ensures services are restored as soon as possible
C. Helps direct the incident to the correct support area
D. Determines how the service provider is perceived

questions.questionText: Which term describes the functionality offered by a service?

Identify the missing words in the following sentence. The purpose of the [?] is to ensure that the organization continually co-creates value with all stakeholders in line with the organization's objectives.

answers.text: D. four dimensions of service management

questions.questionText: What can be described as an operating model for the creation and management of products and services?

Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The purpose of the service configuration management practice is to ensure that accurate and reliable information about the [?], and the CIs that support them, is available when and where it is needed.
Which step of the continual improvement model includes baseline assessments?

answers.text: D. Where do we want to be?

questions.questionText: Which is a purpose of the 'service desk' practice?

answers.text: A. To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible
B. To be the entry point and single point of contact for the service provider with all of its users
C. To support the agreed quality of a service by handling all pre-defined, user-initiated service requests
D. To establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels

questions.questionText: Which usually requires a team of representatives from many stakeholder groups?
Which Guiding principle says that it is not usually necessary to build something new?
What are typically recognized through notifications created by an IT service, CI or monitoring tool?
Which is NOT a component of the service value system?

answers.text: D. The four dimensions of service management

questions.questionText: Which statement about problems is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Problems are not related to incidents.
B. Problems must be resolved quickly in order to restore normal business activity.
C. Problem analysis should focus on one of the four dimensions to achieve a fast diagnosis.
D. Problem prioritization involves risk assessment.

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle recommends assessing the current state and deciding what can be reused?
Which is one of the five aspects of service design?

answers.text: A. Management information systems and tools
B. Risk analysis and management approach
C. Management policy for business case creation

questions.questionText: Which is a purpose of release management?

answers.text: A. To protect the organization's information
B. To handle user-initiated service requests
C. To make new and changed services available for use
D. To move hardware and software to live environments

questions.questionText: What is a change schedule used for?

answers.text: A. To help plan emergency changes
B. To help authorize standard changes
C. To help assign a change authority
D. To help manage normal changes

questions.questionText: Which skill is an essential part of the 'service level management' practice?
What is a set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value for customers in the form of services?
What is defined as a cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents?
Which guiding principle is PRIMARILY concerned with end-to-end service delivery?
Which practice updates information relating to symptoms and business impact?
Which is part of the definition of a customer?

answers.text: A. The role that defines the requirements for a service
B. A means of enabling value co-creation
C. The role that authorizes budget for service consumption
D. A set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value

questions.questionText: Which practice provides a communications point for users to report operational issues, queries and requests?
What is the purpose of the 'monitoring and event management' practice?

answers.text: A. To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
B. To manage workarounds and known errors
C. To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
D. To systematically observe services and service components

questions.questionText: Which are the elements of process control?

answers.text: B. Work instructions, procedures and roles
D. Process owner, policy and objectives

questions.questionText: Which practice identifies metrics that reflect the customer's experience of a service?
Which describes a set of defined steps for implementing improvements?
Which guiding principle considers the importance of customer loyalty?
What is an incident?

answers.text: A. The planned removal of an item that might affect a service
B. A result enabled by one or more outputs
C. A possible future event that could cause harm
D. A service interruption resolved by the use of self-help tools

questions.questionText: Which statement about costs is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Costs removed from the consumer are part of service consumption
B. Costs imposed on the consumer are costs of service utility
C. Costs removed from the consumer are part of the value proposition
D. Costs imposed on the consumer are costs of service warranty

questions.questionText: Identify the missing words in the following sentence. The management of information security incidents usually requires [?].
Which describes a CORRECT approach to change authorization?

answers.text: A. Changes included in the change schedule are pre-authorized and do not need additional authorization
B. Formal changes should be assessed and authorized before they are deployed
C. Emergency changes should be authorized by as many people as possible to reduce risk
D. Formal changes are typically implemented as service requests and authorized by the service desk

questions.questionText: Which is the CORRECT of the 'R' role in a RACI matrix?

answers.text: A. This role ensures that activities are executed correctly
B. This role has ownership of the end result
C. This role is involved in providing knowledge and input
D. This role ensures the flow of information to stakeholders

questions.questionText: Which is a key requirement for a successful service level agreement (SLA)?

answers.text: A. Using individual metrics that relate to the service catalogue
B. Using bundled metrics to relate performance to outcomes
C. Using single-system-based metrics that relate to outputs
D. Using an agreement between the service provider and service supplier

questions.questionText: What is a service?

answers.text: A. A possible event that could cause harm or loss, or make it more difficult to achieve objectives
B. A means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating outcomes that customers want to achieve without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks
C. A tangible or intangible deliverable of an activity
D. Joint activities performed by a service provider and a service consumer to ensure continual value co-creation based on agreed and available service offerings

questions.questionText: Who is responsible for defining metrics for change management?

answers.text: A. The change management process owner
D. The continual service improvement manager

questions.questionText: Which 'service level management' activity helps staff to deliver a more business-focused service?

answers.text: A. Creating targets based on the percentage of uptime of a service
B. Understanding the ongoing requirements of customers
C. Using complex technical terminology in service level agreements (SLAs)

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose that includes observing a service to report selected changes of state identified as events?
When should a workaround be created?

answers.text: A. As soon as possible, once the incident is logged
B. After the resolution of a problem
C. When a problem cannot be resolved quickly
D. When a potential permanent solution has been identified

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle considers how the steps of a process can be performed as efficiently as possible?
What happens if a workaround becomes the permanent way of dealing with a problem that cannot be resolved cost-effectively?

answers.text: A. The problem record is deleted
B. The problem remains in the known error status
C. A change request is submitted to change control
D. Problem management restores the service as soon as possible

questions.questionText: What actions does a service desk take for all issues, queries, and requests that are reported to them?
Which ITIL concept describes governance?

answers.text: D. The four dimensions of service management

questions.questionText: Which approach is CORRECT when applying the guiding principle 'keep it simple and practical'?

answers.text: A. Only add controls and metrics when they are needed
B. Design controls and metrics first, then remove those not adding value
C. Design controls and metrics and add them individually until all are implemented
D. Only add controls and metrics that are required for compliance

questions.questionText: Which is an external input to the service value chain?
Which practice ensures that accurate and reliable information is available about configuration items and the relationships between them?
What should be done first when applying the 'focus on value' guiding principle?

answers.text: A. Identify all suppliers and partners involved in the service
B. Determine the cost of providing the service
C. Identify the outcomes that the service facilitates
D. Determine who the service consumer is in each situation

questions.questionText: In which TWO situations should the ITIL guiding principles be considered? One In every initiative Two In relationships with all stakeholders Three Only in specific initiatives where the principle is relevantfour Only in specific stakeholder relationships where the principle is relevant
What is required by all service desk staff?
Which practice includes the use of approaches such as Lean, Agile, and DevOps with the aim of facilitating a greater amount of change at a quicker rate?
Which of the following should IT service continuity strategy be based on?
Which costs are included in the value proposition of a service?

answers.text: A. Additional expense that the service consumer has because they are using the service
B. Money that the service consumer no longer needs to spend because they are using the service
C. Tangible or intangible results for the service consumer because they are using the service
D. The benefits, usefulness, and importance of the service that are perceived by the service consumer

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose that includes ensuring that risks have been properly assessed?
What is the purpose of the 'deployment management' practice?

answers.text: A. To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business
B. To make new and changed services and features available for use
C. To move new or changed components to live environments
D. To plan and manage the full lifecycle of all IT assets.

questions.questionText: Which statement about metrics is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Process metrics can be used to measure end-to-end service performance
B. Technology metrics can be used to measure component performance and availability
C. Process metrics can be used to measure the utilization of a supplier's network
D. Technology metrics can be used to determine the overall health of a process

questions.questionText: What is the MOST important reason for prioritizing incidents?

answers.text: A. To ensure that user expectations are realistic
B. To ensure that incidents with the highest impact are resolved first
C. To help information-sharing and learning
D. To provide links to related changes and known errors

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle recommends using the minimum number of steps necessary to achieve an objective?

answers.text: C. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which is a key requirement for a successful service level agreement?

answers.text: A. It should be written in legal language
B. It should be simply written and easy to understand
C. It should be based on the service provider's view of the service
D. It should relate to simple operational metrics

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. A [?] is the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services
What is the PRIMARY use of a change schedule?

answers.text: A. To support the 'incident management' practice and improvement planning
C. To plan changes and help avoid conflicts

questions.questionText: What is described by the service value system?

answers.text: A. How to apply the systems approach of the guiding principle think and work holistically
B. Services based on one or more products, designed to address needs of a target consumer group
C. How all the components and activities of the organization work together as a system to enable value creation
D. Joint activities performed by a service provider and a service consumer to ensure continual value co-creation

questions.questionText: What is described by the service value system?

answers.text: A. How to apply the systems approach of the guiding principle think and work holistically
B. Services based on one or more products, designed to address needs of a target consumer group
C. How all the components and activities of the organization work together as a system to enable value creation
D. Joint activities performed by a service provider and a service consumer to ensure continual value co-creation

questions.questionText: Which dimension includes activities and workflows?
Which practice involves the management of vulnerabilities that were not identified before the service went live?
What is the definition of warranty?

answers.text: A. A means of identifying events that could cause harm or loss
B. A means of determining whether a service is fit for purpose
C. A means of identifying a result for a stakeholder
D. A means of determining whether a service is fit for use

questions.questionText: Which practice may involve the initiation of disaster recovery?
Which are elements of the service value system?

answers.text: A. Service provision, service consumption, service relationship management
B. Governance, service value chain, practices
D. Customer value, stakeholder value, organization

questions.questionText: Which is NOT a key focus of the 'information and technology' dimension?

answers.text: A. Workflow management and inventory systems
B. Communication systems and knowledge bases

questions.questionText: Which Practice includes management of workarounds and known errors?
Which practice needs people who understand complex systems and have creative and analytical skills?
What is an output?

answers.text: A. A possible event that could cause harm or loss
B. Something created by carrying out an activity
C. A result for a stakeholder
D. A change of state that has significance for the management of a configuration it

questions.questionText: Where should all master copies of controlled software and documentation be stored?

answers.text: A. In the definitive capacity library
B. In the definitive media library
C. In the definitive security library
D. In the definitive production library

questions.questionText: Which statement about outcome is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Outcomes rely on outputs to deliver results for a stakeholder
B. Outcomes use activities to produce tangible or intangible deliverables
C. Outcomes give service consumers assurance of products or services
D. Outcomes help a service consumer to assess the cost of a specific activity

questions.questionText: Which is provided by the 'engage' value chain activity?

answers.text: A. Ensuring that stakeholder expectations for quality are met
B. Ensuring that stakeholder needs are understood by the organization
C. Ensuring that service components are available when needed
D. Ensuring that services are operated to meet agreed specifications

questions.questionText: What is defined as an unplanned interruption or reduction in the quality of a service?
Which does the ITIL service value system discourage?
Which competencies are required by the 'service level management' practice?

answers.text: C. Business analysis and commercial management
D. Balanced scorecard reviews and maturity assessment

questions.questionText: What can be described as an operating model for the creating and management of products and services?
Which ITIL practice has a purpose that includes reducing the likelihood of incidents?
Which practices are typically involved in the implementation of a problem resolution?1. Continual improvement 2. Service request management 3. Service level management 4. Change control, answers
What is the MAIN benefit of 'problem management'?

answers.text: A. Restoring normal service as quickly as possible
B. Reducing the number and impact of incidents
C. Maximizing the number of successful changes
D. Managing workarounds and known errors

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle helps an organization to understand the impact of an altered element on other elements in a system?

answers.text: D. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: What describes the steps needed to create and deliver a specific service to a consumer?
What is the purpose of the 'problem management' practice?

answers.text: A. To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business
B. To reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents, and managing workarounds and known errors
C. To align the organization's practices and services with changing business needs through the ongoing identification and improvement of services
D. To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle helps an organization to understand the impact of an altered element on other elements in a system?

answers.text: D. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: What describes the steps needed to create and deliver a specific service to a consumer?
Which statement about service relationship management is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. It focuses on the service actions performed by users
B. It requires the service consumer to create resources for the service provider
C. It requires co-operation of both the service provider and service consumer
D. It focuses on the fulfilment of the agreed service actions

questions.questionText: Which dimension considers the application of artificial intelligence to service management?
What is a change schedule PRIMARILY used for?

answers.text: A. To help plan, authorize and schedule emergency changes
B. To publish a list of service requests that users can select
C. To ensure that a single change authority reviews every change
D. To help plan changes, assist in communication and avoid conflicts

questions.questionText: In which step of the 'continual improvement model' is an improvement plan implemented?

answers.text: B. How do we get there?

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. A change is defined as the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on [?].
Which practice provides a single point of contact for users?
How do all value chain activities transform inputs to outputs?

answers.text: A. By using a combination of practices
B. By using a single functional team

questions.questionText: Which is intended to help an organization adopt and adapt ITIL guidance?

answers.text: A. The four dimensions of service

questions.questionText: Which joint activity performed by a service provider and service consumer ensures continual value co-creation?
What does the 'service request management' practice depend on for maximum efficiency?
Which statement about the 'change enablement' practice is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Standard changes are those that need to be scheduled, assessed and authorized following a standard process
B. Normal changes are triggered by the creation of a change request which can be created manually or automated
C. Assessment and authorization of normal changes should be expedited to ensure they can be implemented quickly
D. There should be a separate change authority for standard changes which includes senior managers who understand the risks involved

questions.questionText: Which of the following can be used to access service desks?

answers.text: C. Text and social media messaging

questions.questionText: Which statement about the 'incident management' practice is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. It identifies the cause of major incidents.
B. It authorizes changes to resolve incidents.
C. It maintains detailed procedures for diagnosing incidents.
D. It resolves the highest impact incidents first

questions.questionText: Which statement about a 'continual improvement register' is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. It should be managed at the senior level of the organization
B. It should be used to capture user demand
C. There should only be one for the whole organization
D. It should be re-prioritized as ideas are documented

questions.questionText: Which is included in the purpose of the 'service level management' practice?

answers.text: A. To maximize the number of successful service and product changes
B. To ensure accurate information about the configuration of services is available
C. To set clear business-based targets for service levels
D. To ensure that suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle says that services and processes should NOT provide a solution for every exception?

answers.text: A. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which ITIL practice has the purpose to establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels?
How does a service consumer contribute to the reduction of disk?

answers.text: A. By paying for the service

questions.questionText: Which practice facilitates operational communication between the service provider organization and users in the service consumer organization?

Identify the missing word in the following sentences. A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating [?] that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks.
Which statement BEST describes the value of service strategy to the business?

answers.text: A. It allows higher volumes of successful change
B. It reduces unplanned costs through optimized handling of service outages
C. It reduces the duration and frequency of service outages
D. It enables the service provider to understand what levels of service will make their customers successful

questions.questionText: Which statement about standard changes is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. A full assessment should be completed each time the change is implemented
B. The change can be implemented with less testing if necessary
C. The appropriate change authority should be assigned to each type of change
D. The change does not require additional authorization

questions.questionText: Which of these activities is carried out as part of 'problem management'?

answers.text: C. Escalating incidents to a support team for resolution
D. Trend analysis of incident records

questions.questionText: Which is an important principle of communication in service operation?

answers.text: A. Information should always be communicated
B. It has an intended purpose or a resultant action
C. Meetings are always the best method of communication
D. It is stored in the configuration management system

questions.questionText: Which practice is responsible for moving new or changed components to live or other environments?
Which practice has a purpose that includes helping the organization to maximize value, control costs and manage risks?
Which statement about outcomes is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Outcomes help service consumers achieve outputs
B. Outcomes are one or more services that fulfil the needs of a service consumer
C. Service providers help service consumers achieve outcomes
D. Helping service consumers achieve outcomes reduces service provider costs

questions.questionText: How should automation be implemented?

answers.text: A. By initially concentrating on the most complex tasks
B. By optimizing as much as possible first
C. By replacing human intervention wherever possible
D. By replacing the existing tools first

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose that includes aligning the organization's practices and services with changing business needs?
Which value chain activity ensures the availability of service components?
Which statement about managing incidents is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Low impact incidents should be resolved efficiently, making logging unnecessary
B. The 'incident management' practice should use a single process regardless of the impact of the incident
C. Low impact incidents should be resolved efficiently so the resource required is reduced
D. Incidents with the lowest impact should be resolved first

questions.questionText: Which term is used to describe the prediction and control of income and expenditure within an organization?
Which role approves the cost of services?
Which is included in the purpose of the 'design and transition' value chain activity?

answers.text: A. Ensuring that service components are available when needed
B. Providing transparency and good stakeholder relationships
C. Supporting services according to specifications
D. Continually meeting stakeholder expectations for costs

questions.questionText: Which practice recommends using tools for collaboration and the automated matching of symptoms?
Which statement about the 'continual improvement model' is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Organizations should work through the steps of the model in the sequence in which they are presented
B. The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals
C. The model is applicable to only certain parts of the service value system
D. Organizations should use an additional model or method to link improvements to customer value

questions.questionText: What is the definition of a known error?

answers.text: A. An unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service
B. A cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents
C. A problem that has been analyzed and has not been resolved
D. Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service or other configuration item (CI)

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an example of incident?

answers.text: A. A backup server is being rebooted while services are running on the primary server
B. An application is not available during the business hours
C. A user has requested access to a shared repository
D. A user wants to reset the password of a server

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an example of incident?

answers.text: A. A backup server is being rebooted while services are running on the primary server
B. An application is not available during the business hours
C. A user has requested access to a shared repository
D. A user wants to reset the password of a server

questions.questionText: Which problem management activity ensures that a problem can be easily tracked and management information can be obtained?
What are 'engage,' 'plan,' and 'improve' examples of?
What does 'change enablement' PRIMARILY focus on?

answers.text: B. Changes to products and services
D. Changes to skills and competencies

questions.questionText: Which statement about change management is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. It optimizes overall business risk
C. It ensures that all changes are authorized by the change advisory board (CAB)
D. It ensures that service requests follow the normal change management process

questions.questionText: Which directly assists with the diagnosis and resolution of simple incidents?

answers.text: A. Scripts for collecting user information
B. Use of shift working patterns
D. Creation of a temporary team

questions.questionText: Which practice uses techniques such as SWOT analysis, balanced scorecard reviews, and maturity assessments?
What is defined as any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service?
Which practice is the responsibility of everyone in the organization?
Which is the purpose of the 'monitoring and event management' practice?

answers.text: A. To ensure that accurate and reliable information about the configuration of services is available when and where it is needed
B. To systematically observe services and service components, and record and report selected changes of state
C. To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business
D. To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible

questions.questionText: Which of the four dimensions include the knowledge bases needed to deliver and manage services?
Which are phases of the release and deployment process?1. Release build and test 2. Review and close 3. Categorize and record 4. Change authorization and schedule
What are the three phases of 'problem management'?

answers.text: A. Problem identification, problem control, error control
B. Problem analysis, error identification, incident resolution
C. Problem logging, problem classification, problem resolution
D. Incident management, problem management, change control

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The purpose of the service configuration management practice is to ensure that accurate and reliable information about the configuration of services, and the [?] that support them, is available when and where it is needed.

Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The purpose of the supplier management practice is to ensure that the organization's suppliers and their [?] are managed appropriately to support the seamless provision of quality products and services.
Which describes normal changes?

answers.text: A. Changes that need to be scheduled and assessed following a process
B. Changes that are low-risk and pre-authorized
C. Changes that are typically initiated as service requests
D. Changes that must be implemented as soon as possible

questions.questionText: Which value chain activity communicates the current status of all four dimensions of service management?
Which is a supplier category?
What is an IT asset?

answers.text: A. The removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services
B. Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver a service
C. A request from a user that initiates a service action
D. Any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or service

questions.questionText: Which helps to streamline the fulfillment of service requests?

answers.text: A. Understanding which service requests can be accomplished with limited approvals
B. Creating new workflows for every service request
C. Separating requests relating to service failures from the degradation of services
D. Eliminating service requests which have complex workflows

questions.questionText: Which statement about IT service management is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. It is performed by customers using a mix of IT systems, services, and processes
B. It is performed by IT service providers using a mix of suppliers and their products
C. It is performed by the service desk using a mix of people, process, and technology
D. It is performed by IT service providers using a mix of people, process, and technology

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle is PRIMARILY concerned with consumer's revenue and growth?

answers.text: A. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which process works with incident management to ensure that security breaches are detected and logged?
Which statement about the service value chain is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. The service value chain converts value into demand
B. Each value chain activity uses different combinations of practices to convert inputs into outputs
C. Each value chain activity identifies a requirement for resources from an external supplier
D. The service value chain uses value streams to describe a combination of consumers and providers

questions.questionText: Which activity captures the demand for incident resolution and service requests?
What is defined as a change of state that has significance for the management of an IT service?
What is the purpose of service level management?

answers.text: A. To obtain/build activity that ensures the service components are available when and where they are needed and meet agreed specifications.
B. To ensure that all current and planned IT services are delivered to agreed achievable targets.
C. To establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels.
D. To track and manage improvement ideas from identification to final action, organizations use a database or structured document called a continual improvement register (CIR).

questions.questionText: What is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating outcomes that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks?
What must always be done before an activity is automated?

answers.text: A. Check that the activity has already been optimized
B. Check that suitable new technology has been purchased
C. Ensure that DevOps has been successfully implemented
D. Ensure the solution removes the need for human intervention

questions.questionText: Which practice uses technologies such as intelligent telephony systems, a knowledge base, and monitoring tools?
Which of these should be logged and managed as a problem?

answers.text: A. Trend analysis shows a large number of similar incidents
B. A user requests delivery of a laptop
C. A monitoring tool detects a change of state for a service
D. 'Continual improvement' needs to prioritize an improvement opportunity

questions.questionText: Which dimension focuses on relationships with other organizations that are involved in the design, development, deployment, and delivery of services?
What is defined as any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of a service?
A customer is a person who defines the requirements for a service and takes responsibility for the [?] of service consumption.
What aspect of 'service level management' asks service consumers what their work involves and how technology helps them?
Which describes the 'plan' value chain activity?

answers.text: A. It ensures a shared understanding of the current status and vision for all products and services across the organization
B. It ensures that services are delivered and supported according to agreed specifications and stakeholders' expectations
C. It ensures that service components are available when and where they are needed, and meet agreed specifications
D. It ensures continual improvement of products, services, and practices across all value chain activities

questions.questionText: Which practice coordinates the classification, ownership, and communication of service requests and incidents?
Which guiding principle helps to ensure that better information is available for decision making?

answers.text: A. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: What is a cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents?
Which should be handled by 'service request management'?

answers.text: A. A request to implement a security patch
B. A request to provide a laptop
C. A request to resolve an error in a service
D. A request to change a target in a service level agreement

questions.questionText: Which practice improves customer and user satisfaction by reducing the negative impact of service interruptions?
What are guiding principles?

answers.text: A. A set of interconnected activities that help an organization deliver a valuable service
B. A description of one or more services that help address the needs of a target consumer group
C. A set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value for customers
D. Recommendations that help an organization when adopting a service management approach

questions.questionText: What are the MOST important skills required by service desk staff?
What is warranty?

answers.text: A. Assurance that a product or service will meet agreed requirements
B. The amount of money spent on a specific activity or resource
C. The functionality offered by a product or service to meet a particular need
D. The perceived benefits, usefulness, and importance of something

questions.questionText: Which skill is required by the 'service level management' practice?
What type of change is pre-authorized, low risk, relatively common, and follows a procedure or work instruction?
Which practice requires skills and competencies related to business analysis, supplier management, and relationship management?
What is an event?

answers.text: A. The addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services
B. Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service or other configuration item
C. Cause of one or more incidents
D. An unplanned interruption to a service or reduction in the quality of a service

questions.questionText: What is a definition of a service improvement plan (SIP)?

answers.text: A. A formal plan to implement improvements to a customer's business processes
B. An input from availability management to service level management, detailing the service design plan
C. A formal plan to implement improvements to a service or process
D. An input from financial management for IT services to service level management, detailing the budget plan

questions.questionText: How should the workflow for a new service request be designed?

answers.text: A. Use a single workflow for all types of service requests
B. Leverage existing workflows whenever possible
C. Use different workflows for each type of service request
D. Avoid workflows for simple service requests

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle recommends coordinating all dimensions of service management?

answers.text: C. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: What is NOT within the scope of service catalogue management?

answers.text: A. Contribution to the definition of services
B. Interfaces between all services and supporting services
C. Interfaces between the service catalogue and service portfolio
D. Fulfilment of business service requests

questions.questionText: What describes how components and activities work together to facilitate value creation?

answers.text: A. The ITIL service value system
C. The four dimensions of service management

questions.questionText: Which dimension considers data security and privacy?
Which describes the utility of a service?

answers.text: A. A service that is fit for use
B. A service that meets its service level targets
C. A service that increases constraints on the consumer
D. A service that supports the performance of the consumer

questions.questionText: What is a problem?

answers.text: A. An addition or modification that could have an effect on services
B. Any change of state that has significance for the management of a configuration item
C. A cause or potential cause of one or more incidents
D. An unplanned reduction in the quality of a service

questions.questionText: When should a full risk assessment and authorization be carried out for a standard change?

answers.text: A. Each time the standard change is implemented
B. When the procedure for the standard change is created
C. At least once a year
D. When an emergency change is requested

questions.questionText: Service transition contains detailed descriptions of which processes?

answers.text: A. Change management, service asset and configuration management, release and deployment management
B. Change management, capacity management, event management, service request management
C. Service level management, service portfolio management, service asset and configuration management
D. Service asset and configuration management, release and deployment management, request fulfillment

questions.questionText: Which is an objective of the design coordination process?

answers.text: A. To produce service design packages and ensure they are handed over to service transition
B. To assess and evaluate all changes and their impact on service designs
C. To document the initial structure and relationship between services and customers
D. To gather and document new service level requirements from the customer

questions.questionText: Which is a purpose of the 'service level management' practice?

answers.text: A. To establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders
B. To ensure that the organization's suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately
C. To set clear business-based targets for service levels
D. To support the agreed quality of a service handling all agreed, user-initiated service requests

questions.questionText: An SLA is a service level agreement. Which describes the 'watermelon SLA' effect?

answers.text: A. A single SLA defines target service levels for multiple customers, so every customer sees reports about other customers' experiences.
B. The metrics in an SLA are focused on internal measures, so that reports show everything is good, while the customer is not satisfied.
C. SLA targets change very frequently, so that each report includes new measures and trends cannot be analyzed.
D. Introducing SLAs for a service enables the customer to see that the service provider is doing a really good job, so this improves satisfaction.

questions.questionText: When is the earliest that a workaround can be documented in 'problem management'?

answers.text: A. After the problem has been logged
B. After the problem has been prioritized
C. After the problem has been analyzed
D. After the problem has been resolved

questions.questionText: Which dimension includes the knowledge needed for the management of services?
Which guiding principle recommends standardizing and streamlining manual tasks?
What can be used to determine if a service is 'fit for purpose'?
What is the purpose of the 'relationship management' practice?

answers.text: A. To support the agreed quality of a service handling all agreed, user-initiated service requests
B. To set clear business-based targets for service performance
C. To establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders
D. To align the organization's practices and services with changing business needs

questions.questionText: What includes governance as a component?
What is the CORRECT definition of service management?

answers.text: A. A set of specialized assets for transitioning services into the live operational environment
B. A set of specialized organizational capabilities for delivering value to customers in the form of services
C. The capability of supplier to deliver services to providers in exchange for money
D. The capability of service providers to minimize their costs without reducing the value of the services

questions.questionText: What takes place in the 'Did we get there?' step of the continual service improvement (CSI) approach?

answers.text: B. The production of a detailed CSI plan
C. Verifying that improvement targets have been achieved

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle helps to ensure that each improvement effort has more focus and is easier to maintain?
What considerations influence the supplier strategy of an organization?

answers.text: B. Type of cooperation with suppliers
C. Corporate culture of the organization

questions.questionText: Which practice provides users with a way to get various requests arranged, explained and coordinated?

Which two statements about the guiding principles are CORRECT?
1. The guiding principles support continual improvement
2. Each guiding principle applies to a selection of the available stakeholder groups
3. Organizations should decide which one of the guiding principles is relevant to them
4. Organizations should consider how the guiding principles interact with each other
What is typically needed to assign complex incidents to support groups?
Which is an example of a business related measurement?

answers.text: A. The number of passengers checked in
B. The average time to response to change requests
C. The average resolution time for incidents
D. The number of problems resolved

questions.questionText: Which service level metrics are BEST for measuring user experience?

answers.text: B. Metrics for the percentage of uptime of a service
D. Metrics linked to defined outcomes

questions.questionText: What do customer perceptions and business outcomes help to define?

answers.text: A. The value of a service
C. The total cost of a service

questions.questionText: Which practice makes new services available for use?
Which service management dimension is focused on activities and how these are coordinated?
Which service catalogue view is considered beneficial when constructing the relationship between services, SLAs, OLAs, and other underpinning agreements?
Which statement about a service value stream is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. it uses inputs and outputs prescribed by ITIL
B. It is a service value chain activity
C. It integrates practices for a specific scenario
D. It provides an operating model for service providers

questions.questionText: What is a configuration item?

answers.text: A. Any financially valuable component that can contribute to delivery of an IT product or service
B. Any component that needs to be managed in order to deliver an IT service
C. Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service
D. A problem that has been analyzed but has not been resolved

questions.questionText: Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement' practice?

answers.text: A. Populating and maintaining the asset register
B. Providing a clear path for users to report issues, queries, and requests
C. Delivering tactical and operational engagement with customers

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose that includes maximizing success by ensuring that risks have been properly assessed?
What varies in size and complexity, and uses functions to achieve its objectives?
Which statement about the 'four Ps' of service design is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Processes refers to skill and training
B. Partners refers to suppliers and vendors
C. People refers to technology and tools
D. Products refers to producers and metrics

questions.questionText: An organization asks a stakeholder to review a planned change. Which guiding principle does this demonstrate?

answers.text: D. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement' practice?

answers.text: A. Handling compliments and complaints from users to identify improvements
B. Improving relationships with and between stakeholders
C. Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives
D. Identifying the cause of unplanned interruptions to service

questions.questionText: Which guiding principle considers customer and user experience?

answers.text: D. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose that includes the handling of pre-defined, user-initiated demands for service?
Which service transition process provides guidance about converting data into information?

answers.text: D. Service asset and configuration management

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'deployment management' practice?

answers.text: A. To ensure services achieve agreed and expected performance
B. To make new or changed services available for use
C. To move new or changed components to live environments
D. To set clear business-based targets for service performance

questions.questionText: Which benefit is MOST aligned with the guiding principle 'progress iteratively with feedback'?

answers.text: A. Service providers are able to respond more quickly to customer needs
B. Bottlenecks in the service provider's workflow are identified.
C. The complexities of the service provider's IT systems are identified.
D. The service provider gains a better understanding of the customer experience.

questions.questionText: Which practice would help a user gain access to an application that they need to use?
Which statement about service requests is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Complex service requests should be dealt with as normal changes
B. Service requests that require simple workflows should be dealt with as incidents
C. Service requests require workflows that should use manual procedures and avoid automation
D. Service requests are usually formalized using standard procedures for initiation, approval and fulfillment

questions.questionText: How should an organization prioritize incidents?

answers.text: A. Ask the user for their preferred resolution timeframe.
B. Assess the availability of the appropriate support team.
C. Use an agreed classification which is based on the business impact of the incident.
D. Create an order of incidents based on the dates and times when they were logged.

questions.questionText: Which is a use of the change schedule?

answers.text: B. Deciding the approval authority for changes

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'information security management' practice?

answers.text: A. To ensure that accurate and reliable information about the configuration of services is available when and where it is needed
B. To observe services and service components
C. To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business
D. To plan and manage the full lifecycle of all IT assets

questions.questionText: Which gives a user access to a system?
In service relationships, what is a benefit of identifying consumer roles?

answers.text: A. It enables effective stakeholder management
B. It provides shared service expectations
C. It removes constraints from the customer
D. It enables a common definition of value

questions.questionText: Which is included in the purpose of the 'deliver and support' value chain activity?

answers.text: A. Meeting stakeholder expectations for time to market
B. Understanding the organization's service vision
D. Providing services to agreed specifications

questions.questionText: Which practice requires that staff demonstrate excellent customer service skills, such as empathy and emotional intelligence?
Which is a key consideration for the guiding principle 'keep it simple and practical'?

answers.text: A. Try to create a solution for every exception
B. Start with a complex solution, then simplify
C. Understand how each element contributes to value creation
D. Ignore the conflicting objectives of different stakeholders

questions.questionText: Which is a recommendation of the guiding principle 'think and work holistically'?

answers.text: A. Conduct a review of existing service management practices and decide what to keep and what to discard
B. Review how an improvement initiative can be organized into smaller, manageable sections that can be completed in a timely manner
C. Review service management practices and remove any unnecessary complexity
D. Use the four dimensions of service management to ensure coordination of all aspects of an improvement initiative

questions.questionText: Which statement about known errors and problems is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Known error is the status assigned to a problem after it has been analysed
B. A known error is the cause of one or more problems
C. Known errors cause vulnerabilities, problems cause incidents
D. Known errors are managed by technical staff, problems are managed by service management staff

questions.questionText: What should be done to determine the appropriate metrics for measuring a new service?

answers.text: A. Measuring the performance over the first six months, and basing a solution on the results
B. Asking customers to provide numerical targets that meet their needs
C. Using operational data to provide detailed service reports
D. Asking customers open questions to establish their requirements

questions.questionText: How does information about problems and known errors contribute to 'incident management'?

answers.text: A. It enables the reassessment of known errors
B. It enables quick and efficient diagnosis of incidents
C. It removes the need for collaboration during incident resolution
D. It removes the need for regular customer updates

questions.questionText: Which function is responsible for the management of a data centre?
What are the MOST important skills required by service desk staff?
Which is a low risk change that has been pre-approved so that no additional authorization is needed?
Which TWO statements about the 'service request management' practice are CORRECT?

answers.text: 1. Service requests are part of normal service delivery
2. Complaints can be handled as service requests
3. Service requests result from a failure in service
4. Normal changes should be handled as service requests

questions.questionText: Which practice has a purpose to support the quality of the service by handling all agreed user initiated service requests?
What can help to reduce resistance to a planned improvement when applying the guiding principle 'collaborate and promote visibility'?

answers.text: A. Restricting information about the improvement to essential stakeholders only.
B. Increasing collaboration and visibility for the improvement.
C. Involving customers after all planning has been completed.
D. Engaging every stakeholder group in the same way, with the same communication.

questions.questionText: Which statement about change authorities is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Change authorities are only required for authorizing emergency changes
B. Change authorities are assigned when each change is deployed
C. Change authorities are only required for authorizing normal changes
D. Change authorities are assigned for each type of change and change model

questions.questionText: What three elements make up the Service Portfolio?

answers.text: A. Customer portfolio, service catalogue and retired services
B. Customer portfolio, configuration management system and service catalogue
C. Service pipeline, service catalogue and retired services
D. Service pipeline, configuration management system and service catalogue

questions.questionText: What MAIN factors are considered to assess the priority of an incident?
Which is NOT a component of the service value system?
Which guiding principle discourages 'silo activity'?

answers.text: D. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: What should be considered as part of the 'partners and suppliers' dimension?

answers.text: A. The level of integration and formality involved in the relationships between organizations
B. The activities, workflows, controls and procedures needed to achieve the agreed objectives
C. The information created, managed and used in the course of service provision and consumption
D. The required skills and competencies of teams and individual members of the organization

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word in the following sentence. The purpose of the 'information security management' practice is to [?] the organization's information.
Which statement about the 'optimize and automate' guiding principle is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. Activities should be automated before they are optimized
B. Automation is best applied to non-standard tasks
C. Technology eliminates the need for human intervention
D. Automation frees human resources for more complex activities

questions.questionText: What should all 'continual improvement' decisions be based on?

answers.text: A. Accurate and carefully analysed data
B. Details of how services are measured

questions.questionText: When should the effectiveness of a problem workaround be assessed?

answers.text: A. Whenever the workaround is used
B. Whenever the problem is resolved
C. Whenever the workaround becomes a known error
D. Whenever the problem is prioritized

questions.questionText: Which is NOT a structure of service desk that is described in the ITIL service operation guidance?
How does customer engagement contribute to the 'service level management' practice?

answers.text: 1. It captures information that metrics can be based on
2. It ensures the organization meets defined service levels
3. It defines the workflows for service requests

questions.questionText: Which describes outcomes?

answers.text: B. Results desired by a stakeholder
C. Configuration of an organization's resources
D. Functionality offered by a product or service

questions.questionText: Which stage of the service lifecycle has the purpose of looking for ways to improve process efficiency and cost effectiveness?
What is recommended by the guiding principle 'progress iteratively with feedback'?

answers.text: A. A current state assessment that is carried out at the start of an improvement initiative
B. The identification of all interested parts at the start of an improvement initiative
C. An improvement initiative that is broken into a number of manageable sections
D. An assessment of how all the parts of an organization will affect an improvement initiative

questions.questionText: What is used to link activities within the service value chain?
Why should service desk staff detect recurring issues?

answers.text: B. To escalate incidents to the correct support team
C. To ensure effective handling of service requests
D. To engage the correct change authority

questions.questionText: Which helps to manage an incident when it is unclear which support team should be working on the incident?
What helps diagnose and resolve a simple incident?

answers.text: B. Formation of a temporary team

questions.questionText: Which statement about change authorization is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. A change authority should be assigned to each type of change and change model
B. Centralizing change authorization to a single person is the most effective means of authorization
C. The authorization of normal changes should be expedited to ensure they can be implemented quickly
D. Standard changes are high risk and should be authorized by the highest level of change authority

questions.questionText: Identify the missing words in the following sentence. When an organization has decided to improve a service, it should start by considering [?].
Which will NOT be handled as a service request?

answers.text: A. The degradation of a service
B. The replacement of a toner cartridge
C. The provision of a laptop
D. A complaint about a support team

questions.questionText: How should an organization adopt continual improvement methods?

answers.text: A. Use a new method for each improvement the organization handles
B. Select a few key methods for the types of improvement that the organization handles
C. Build the capability to use as many improvement methods as possible
D. Select a single method for all improvements that the organization handles

questions.questionText: Which dimension considers how knowledge assets should be protected?
What type of change is MOST likely to be managed by the 'service request management' practice?
Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
What can be used to help determine the impact level of a problem?
What is the purpose of the 'incident management' practice?

answers.text: A. To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible
B. To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
C. To reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents
D. To support the agreed service quality by effective handling of all agreed user-initiated service requests

questions.questionText: Which action is performed by a service provider?

answers.text: B. Authorizing budget for service consumption
C. Ensuring access to agreed resources

questions.questionText: Which is a key activity carried out in the 'did we get there?' step of the 'continual improvement' model?
Which statement about service desks is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. The service desk should work in close collaboration with support and development teams
B. The service desk should rely on self-service portals instead of escalation to support teams
C. The service desk should remain isolated from technical support teams
D. The service desk should escalate all technical issues to support and development teams

questions.questionText: Which two practices use workarounds?

answers.text: A. Change enablement and continual improvement
B. Change enablement and problem management
C. Problem management and incident management
D. Incident management and continual improvement

questions.questionText: How should an organization include third-party suppliers in the continual improvement of services?

answers.text: A. Ensure suppliers include details of their approach to service improvement in contracts
B. Require evidence that the supplier uses agile development methods
C. Require evidence that the supplier implements all improvements using project management practices
D. Ensure that all supplier problem management activities result in improvements

questions.questionText: Which process is used to compare the value that new services offer with the value of the services they have replaced?
What is the effect of increased automation on the 'service desk1 practice?

answers.text: A. Increased ability to focus on fixing technology instead of supporting people
B. Greater ability to focus on customer experience when personal contact is needed
C. Elimination of the need to escalate incidents to support teams
D. Decrease in self-service incident logging and resolution

questions.questionText: Which is a risk that might be removed from a service consumer by an IT service?

answers.text: A. Service provider ceasing to trade

questions.questionText: Identify the missing words in the following sentence. The 'incident management' practice should maintain [?] for logging and managing incidents.
Which statement about outcomes is CORRECT?

answers.text: A. An outcome can be enabled by more than one output
B. Outcomes are how the service performs
C. An output can be enabled by one or more outcomes
D. An outcome is a tangible or intangible activity

questions.questionText: Which value chain activity ensures that service components meet agreed specifications?
Which guiding principle recommends collecting data before deciding what can be re-used?

answers.text: B. Keep it simple and practical

questions.questionText: Which TWO statements about an organization's culture are CORRECT? (Choose two.)

answers.text: 1. It is created from shared values based on how it carries out its work
2. It is determined by the type of technology used to support services
3. It should be based on the culture of prospective suppliers
4. It should be based on the objectives of the organization

questions.questionText: Identify the missing word(s) in the following sentence. The service desk should be the entry point and single point of contact for the [?] with all of its users.
Which dimension of service management considers governance, management, and communication?
Why should some service requests be fulfilled with no additional approvals?

answers.text: A. To ensure that spending is properly accounted for
B. To ensure that information security requirements are met
C. To streamline the fulfillment workflow
D. To set user expectations for fulfillment times

questions.questionText: Which practice has a strong influence on the user experience and perception of the service provider?
Which practice has a purpose that includes restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible?
How does categorization of incidents assist the 'incident management' practice?
